descriptions.description:
Step: dryadAcceptEditReject - action:dryadAcceptEditRejectAction Rejected by Christine Mayo(christine.mayo@unc.edu), reason: The file in your submission titled "Children's Information Preferences" appears to contain personally identifiable human subject information. Data archived in Dryad is publicly available and any human subject data must be properly anonymized and prepared under applicable legal and ethical guidelines. We welcome you to resubmit any data that is appropriate for sharing. The following article may be helpful:
Hrynaszkiewicz I ,Norton ML ,Vickers AJ ,Altman DG. Preparing raw clinical data for publication: guidance for journal editors, authors, and peer reviewers. BMJ 2010;340:c181 http://dx.doi.org/10.1136/bmj.c181
Please note that Dryad is also currently only able to accept data in English, and so many of the variable names in the aforementioned file would also need to be translated into English along with the anonymization before we are able to accept the file for archiving. on 2014-10-15T15:33:58Z (GMT)
